title: North America Survival Tips
content: Temperatures vary—prepare for hot deserts, cold winters, and forests. Shelter: Use pine branches, leaves, and debris for insulation. Water: Boil stream or lake water. Avoid bright green or oily surfaces. Food: Hunt rabbits, squirrels, fish. Gather acorns (boil to remove bitterness), berries (avoid white berries), and cattail roots.
